name: Flashiness or high-flow frequency
functionStatement: "Integrates the range of ""typical"" flows experienced by other processes. Examines the degree to which upstream infrastructure or land uses have fundamentally altered flow regimes (e.g., hydropeaking, dams, withdrawals)."
descriptionMarkdown: Compares current daily-flow pattern to the natural regime, combining IHA metrics with the Richards-Baker flashiness index to screen for alteration from dams, withdrawals, or urbanization.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Calculate the Richards-Baker Flashiness Index from daily flows. Where ungauged, use qualitative storm-response observations as a screening proxy.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Observed rise and fall patterns align with local norms for the stream type.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Slightly higher flash surges or modestly longer dry periods than expected.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Clearly more frequent flash events or dry periods that are significantly longer than normal.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Extreme flashiness from small storms, or dry periods long enough to indicate a change in flow regime.
